lifestyle.text: In the 1950s, people mostly wrote letters to stay in touch. Telephones were rare and mainly in big offices.
Most families woke up early. Women swept courtyards, men read newspapers or went to fetch milk in steel cans.

culture.text: Men wore dhotis and kurtas, women wore cotton sarees with large prints.
Diwali was celebrated with oil lamps, sweets made at home, and small local fireworks.

food.text: People ate rice, dal, seasonal vegetables. Sweets like jalebi were common in markets.

stories.title: A morning in 1952
stories.text: Radha woke up to the rooster crowing. The smell of boiling milk filled the courtyard as her father read the newspaper aloud.

phrases.text: Arre bhaiya, mobile kya hota hai? Hum toh chitthiyan likhte hain!
Bazar se doodh lana mat bhoolna.
